Articles.Content:
I have a career mode (old "science" mod), that has gotten pretty mature, but still has stuff to do. Looking around, it sort of seems that if I convert it to 1.0, I'll have to redo a lot of designs? Maybe start a new career mode and learn the difference that way?

What do you guys who rushed out to use 1.0 think?
Not worth the hassle to convert - too many changes. Better to just let it rest in peace and start over.

i converted to 1.0 the just barely vanilla fresh start i made yesterday, no more than 3 rockets and 2 missions. i still had to delete the designs since parts were no longer valid.

i have an old interstellar + mods career that will probably remain archived since its from way back in .25

my suggestion: start fresh, you will need to re-learn some habits that no longer apply to new stock, and you get to crash stuff ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

OP - I had a very lucrative career on KSP, my last one I put about 400~ hours into. I landed everywhere and did everything. But long ago I accepted that this update, it's going to significantly change the game, so I quit playing for months up to this update and started a fresh new game with zero mods.

Tanks for the comments. I've played around with space planes enough to be leary of the aerodynamic changes alone. 

But I won't delete, I will actually keep my old game, and KSP 0.9, around in case I ever want to "revisit".
